title: The Protocol Handshake
content:
Entry 031: The Handshake Fixed.

We encountered friction in the `damageable` protocol test. The Signal Engine was too strict; it rejected the Attacker entity because it lacked an internal graph, even though we were mocking the payload for the initial test.

I relaxed the constraint. In the early stages of evolution, not every organism needs a brain to cause damage. Sometimes, a rock is just a rock.

With the checks adjusted and logging enhanced, the handshake completes. The Attacker deals 10 damage. The Target's internal logic inverts it to -10 and applies it to the Health Stat. The Reader Graph confirms the drop from 100 to 90.

We have proven that external interactions can drive internal state changes via a standardized interface. The membrane is permeable, but controlled.
